entry.title: How to Use Almendra SC: A Gothic Inspired Typeface Perfect for Classic Design Details
entry.summary: Font of the Week About Almendra SC Almendra SC, part of Almendra…
entry.content:
Font of the Week

About Almendra SC

Almendra SC, part of Almendra font family, is an elegant typeface inspired by Gothic inspired small capitals typography. Drawing inspiration from classic calligraphy and medieval scripts, Almendra SC brings a sense of historical depth to any design it's part of. The Gothic influence is subtle, making it suitable for projects that require a classic and timeless aesthetic.

Almendra SC Type Details

Featuring bold strokes and pronounced serifs, Almendra SC boasts an authoritative yet graceful presence. The use of small capitals in this typeface adds to its sophisticated flair, creating a blend of old-world charm and modern-day functionality. These design details make it ideal for classic design details, offering a perfect solution for branding projects that aim for credibility and tradition.

How to use Almendra SC for Logo

Almendra SC, with its distinct character and small capitals typography, works wonderfully in logos that require a touch of the traditional. Its clarity and weight make it particularly suitable for logos that need to communicate reliability and heritage. Ensure to use it thoughtfully in logo design, balancing it with ample whitespace to maintain legibility and impact.

How to use Almendra SC for Branding & Marketing

When it comes to branding and marketing, Almendra SC excels in creating a sense of elegance and history. This typeface is excellent for use in print materials like business cards and letterheads, as well as digital assets where distinctive typographic voices are needed. Using small capitals effectively can give your brand a unique voice and presence. If you need more weight to support your project, you can pair Almendra SC with standard Alemendra, or anther sans serif. 

Almendra SC Font Pairings

To make the most of Almendra SC in your projects, consider these complementary font pairings from Google Fonts:

  • Merriweather: With its refined serif design, Merriweather pairs well with Almendra SC for text-heavy designs, providing readability and a cohesive look.
  • Open Sans: This versatile sans-serif offers a clean contrast to Almendra SC's intricate details, ideal for modern applications needing a classic touch.
  • Roboto: The geometric forms of Roboto provide a contemporary counterbalance to Almendra SC's historic style, perfect for dynamic and balanced branding.

Color Inspiration of the Week

This week, enjoy a modern color palette featuring beige and earthy neutrals.

entry.title: Almendra: The Ideal Calligraphy Typeface for Children’s Books and Long Text
entry.summary: Font of the Week About Almendra Almendra is a captivating calligraphic typeface…
entry.content:
Font of the Week

About Almendra

Almendra is a captivating calligraphic typeface that seamlessly blends historical elegance with modern functionality. Inspired by Chancery hand—a refined script developed during the Italian Renaissance for official documents and correspondence—Almendra embodies the fluidity and grace of this influential calligraphic style, which was widely used in the Papal Chancery and played a key role in shaping the development of italic typefaces in printing. Rooted in the beauty of medieval manuscripts, Almendra exudes old-world sophistication while remaining versatile for contemporary design. Its elegant serif structure strikes a nice balance between tradition and creativity, making it especially well-suited for children's books and extended text passages.

Almendra Type Details

Almendra is designed with generous spacing and a tall x-height, enhancing readability even in dense passages. Its smooth curves and elegant, gothic-informed strokes exude warmth, familiarity, and history, making it an ideal choice for topics like courts, magic, and traditions. The typeface adds a touch of elegance and clarity. Additionally, Almendra features a small cap and a display variation(our favorite!), making this font family much more versatile.

Almendra Italics

Almendra Italics brings a dynamic flavor to the typeface, inspired by the crispness of traditional calligraphy penmanship. The Italics maintain the same character as the regular style but with a sharper flair. They are perfect for adding a minimal but expressive touch to brand elements.

How to use Almendra for Logo

Almendra is a sophisticated choice for logo design, evoking a vintage or Gothic storybook feel. For optimal clarity and impact, the bold weight offers more legibility at smaller scales.

How to use Almendra for Branding & Marketing

Almendra’s timeless style makes it a valuable asset for branding, particularly within publishing, children’s products, and artisanal brands with a historic vibe. Its classic look and readability give it an edge for marketing materials that seek to establish nostalgia and old-timey vibes. To reduce the old-timey vibe of Almendra, we can also combine Almendra with other less ornate typefaces to balance visual harmony.

Almendra Font Pairings

  • Cabin: This contemporary sans-serif complements Almendra’s vintage cues while providing a clean counterpart; this pairing is suitable for modern children’s literature designs.
  • Raleway: A versatile sans-serif that balances Almendra’s elaborate design with a minimalistic style, perfect for branding in elegant contexts.
  • Karla: With its straightforward personality, Karla provides a great contrast to Almendra, excellent for branding that requires a mix of sophistication and approachability.

Color Inspiration of the Week

This week, enjoy this beautiful pale pink color palette featuring complementary mint green shades.

entry.title: Alumni Sans Collegiate One: A Varsity Letter Font for Sporty and Athletic Design Projects
entry.summary: Alumni sans collegiate one font inspiration Font of the Week About Alumni…
entry.content:
Font of the Week

About Alumni Sans Collegiate One

Alumni Sans Collegiate One is a bold display font that embodies the spirit of sports and athleticism. This typeface is part of the Alumni typeface family, which is designed to grab attention and make a strong visual impact. Inspired by collegiate and varsity letterman jackets, the font evokes energy and competition that harkens back to high school and college sports teams.

Alumni Sans Collegiate One Type Details

Alumni Sans Collegiate One is defined by its collegiate letter jacket vibe, featuring thick, bold strokes and clean lines, making this typeface the perfect choice for a standout display font in sporty and athletic design projects. Designed for large display sizes, its varsity-style letters and distinctive details come to life when viewed at scale. Ideal for high-energy environments, Alumni Sans Collegiate shines in sports team branding, event posters, and merchandise where an active, competitive spirit is essential.

Alumni Sans Collegiate One Italics & Small Caps

Alumni Sans Collegiate One has a dedicated italic (a slight slant) and a small cap style to support your italicized and small capital designs. 

How to use Alumni Sans Collegiate One for Logo

Alumni Collegiate One’s details are visible primarily at large display sizes, making it illegible as a logo font since many details will be lost. The Standard Alumni Sans is a much better choice for logo design, considering the standard version has multiple font weights and italics.

How to use Alumni Sans Collegiate for Branding & Marketing

Alumni Sans Collegiate One excels in branding and marketing, particularly in environments that demand attention, such as sporting events, fitness campaigns, and athletic-focused promotions. Use it to create bold headlines and powerful call-to-actions to convey energy, enthusiasm, and excitement. With its strong, bold lines, Alumni Sans Collegiate is the perfect choice for team logos, sports brands, and athletic gear.

Alumni Sans Collegiate One Font Pairings

Pairing Alumni Sans Collegiate One with other fonts can enhance its effectiveness in design projects. Here are three recommended pairings:

  • Roboto: This sans-serif typeface pairs well with Alumni Sans Collegiate, providing a modern and clean look suitable for body text.
  • Merriweather: Known for its readability, Merriweather complements the boldness of Alumni Sans Collegiate while adding a touch of elegance.
  • Open Sans: A highly legible typeface, Open Sans works seamlessly with Alumni Sans Collegiate, perfect for creating a balanced design hierarchy.

Color Inspiration of the Week

This week enjoy this green themed color palette, energized with a highlight yellow.

entry.title: Alumni Sans Pinstripe: A Thin and Light Font Perfect for Large-Scale Displays
entry.summary: Alumni sans pinstripe font inspiration Font of the Week About Alumni Sans…
entry.content:
Font of the Week

About Alumni Sans Pinstripe

Alumni Sans Pinstripe is a striking thin and light font designed specifically for large-scale displays. Classified as a sans serif typeface, it is known for its minimalistic and elegant appearance. The inspiration behind Alumni Sans Pinstripe stems from the classic aesthetics of simple lines and modern typography, paying homage to traditional pinstripe patterns in sporty, party, and celebratory settings.

Alumni Sans Pinstripe Type Details

Alumni Sans Pinstripe features thin, elongated lines and airy spacing that give it a light, sophisticated appearance. These design elements make it an ideal choice for display purposes, especially in large-scale visuals. Its elegance and clarity ensure versatility across a wide range of graphic design projects like posters and digital displays. The Alumni Font Family also includes a standard version and a Collegiate variation, perfect for designs that need a playful, sporty touch.

Alumni Sans Pinstripe Italics

The italic style of Alumni Sans Pinstripe retains its influentially clean lines while introducing a slight slant to add an element of emphasis. This version reflects the same inspiration from pinstripe aesthetics, maintaining its minimalist charm while offering designers flexibility for emphasized text in brand identity or marketing materials.

How to use Alumni Sans Pinstripe for Logo

Given Alumni Sans Pinstripe is designed for large display sizes, it is best used as a marketing font that supports the logo. Its long, thin strokes can affect the logo’s legibility in smaller scales.

How to use Alumni Sans Pinstripe for Branding & Marketing

Alumni Sans Pinstripe creates an approachable yet sophisticated image for branding and marketing efforts. At display sizes, its seamless blend of simplicity and elegance makes it an ideal choice for high-end brands or minimalist design campaigns. The typeface’s versatility makes it perfect for both print and digital media, elevating brand identity with clarity and precision.

Alumni Sans Pinstripe Font Pairings

Alumni Sans Pinstripe stands out through its minimalist elegance and sophisticated aura, making it an excellent choice for typography, graphic design, and large-scale displays. Its versatile nature ensures it can be creatively implemented in numerous design projects using the right pairings and applications. Pairing Alumni Sans Pinstripe with complementary fonts can amplify its graceful presence:

  • Montserrat: Known for its geometric simplicity, Montserrat pairs well by balancing the lightness of Alumni Sans Pinstripe with its own bold and rounded forms.
  • Merriweather: This serif font complements Alumni Sans Pinstripe by providing a contrast with its traditional and readable serif details, useful for creating visual hierarchy.
  • Roboto: With its contemporary and versatile look, Roboto offers a subtle harmony with Alumni Sans Pinstripe, enhancing modern branding efforts across various media.

Color Inspiration of the Week

This week, enjoy this color palette combining neutral colors with bright yellow.

entry.title: Mastering Alumni Sans: A Guide to Using the Versatile Condensed Sans Serif Font
entry.summary: Alumni sans font inspiration Font of the Week About Alumni Sans Alumni…
entry.content:
Font of the Week

About Alumni Sans

Alumni Sans is a beautiful sans-serif font that epitomizes the elegance and precision of Swiss design typography. Inspired by the clean, functional aesthetics of Swiss design, this font is both versatile and modern, making it a perfect choice for designers looking for clarity and simplicity in their projects.

Alumni Sans Type Details

Alumni Sans features clean lines and excellent legibility, making it suitable for various design applications. Its sans-serif nature provides a modern and refined look, ideal for branding, marketing, and editorial design. The geometric simplicity and balanced proportions ensure it stands out without overshadowing other design elements. Alumni Font Family also includes a Pinstripe and a Collegiate variation for designs that need a fun and sporty feel.

Alumni Sans Italics

The italics of Alumni Sans have the same simplicity and elegance. With a subtle slant, they bring dynamism to the text while keeping the overall aesthetic consistent with the font's straightforward design.

Alumni Sans Variable Font

Alumni Sans Variable Font offers incredible flexibility, thanks to its weight axis. This axis allows designers to adjust the style from lighter to bolder weights seamlessly. Unlike traditional fonts with limited weights, this feature lets you find the perfect stroke thickness for any project.

How to use Alumni Sans for Logo

Alumni Sans can be an excellent choice for logos where a clean and modern look is desired. Its versatility in weight allows you to select a thickness that ensures legibility at any size. However, if the brand requires an ornate or rustic style, or is looking for a vintage vibe, another font might be more appropriate.

How to use Alumni Sans for Branding & Marketing

With its clean lines and modern aesthetic, Alumni Sans is ideal for creating a cohesive brand identity. It works beautifully across digital and print platforms, ensuring brand consistency. Its clarity enhances marketing materials, from websites to brochures, by making content accessible and engaging.

Alumni Sans Font Pairings

These pairings enhance the usability and visual appeal of Alumni Sans, offering variety and flexibility for various design projects. 

  • Roboto: Combines well with Alumni Sans due to its equally modern design and versatility. 
  • Merriweather: Provides a contrasting serif option that pairs elegantly with the clean look of Alumni Sans. 
  • Lato: Another sans-serif font that brings warmth and friendliness, complementing the sharpness of Alumni Sans.

Color Inspiration of the Week

Enjoy this color palette exploring warm and cold tones of early spring.

entry.title: How to Use Oswald With Design Examples
entry.summary:
In This Issue…

  • Branding Example of the Week: Kindsight
  • Font of the Week: Oswald
entry.content:
In This Issue…

  • Branding Example of the Week: Kindsight
  • Font of the Week: Oswald

Font of the Week

All About Oswald

Oswald draws inspiration from gothic sans-serif typefaces of the late 19th century. Its condensed form and sharp lines make it a space-efficient choice for headlines and banners. The font's strong, industrial character lends itself well to editorial design and advertising where boldness is key.  Its bold, condensed style makes it effective for conveying strength and authority.  With its sharp lines, Oswald excels in headlines, banners, and impactful text.

Font Details:

  • Condensed Structure makes it easy for space-efficient multi-column design 
  • Bold strokes give a strong, authoritative appearance
  • Versatile for Headlines

How to Use Oswald for Logo?

Oswald is a condensed sans-serif that offers a tall and structured look. It works well for logos that need to convey stability, authority, or boldness, making it a great choice for media, sports, or corporate branding. It pairs well with sharp, clean lines and simple iconography for a powerful and assertive logo.

How to Use Oswald for Branding & Marketing?

Oswald’s structured and authoritative look is perfect for branding that needs to convey strength and reliability. It works well for corporate marketing materials, billboards, or magazine ads where clarity and boldness are key. Oswald helps create a brand identity that is strong and commanding.

Oswald Font Pairing

  • Oswald + Roboto
  • Oswald + Lora
  • Oswald + Poppins

Branding Example of the Week

Financial Services Branding:  Kindsight

Kindsight is a platform aiming to simplify and optimize fundraising efforts for organizations. Using a simple sans serif with winding letterforms, Kindsight's new branding introduces the idea of fluidity and connectivity. The new branding also features a new color palette of earthy greens and warm maroons and a series of hand-drawn illustrations(these elements together almost like a combination of old and new brandings from Robinhood). Both are working to a modern, warm, and inviting brand.

entry.title: How to Use Lato for Design Ideas
entry.summary:
In This Issue…

  • Branding Example of the Week: Lloyds Bank
  • Font of the Week: Lato
  • Spring Color Palette: Lime
entry.content:
In This Issue…

  • Branding Example of the Week: Lloyds Bank
  • Font of the Week: Lato
  • Spring Color Palette: Lime 

Font of the Week

All About Lato

Lato means 'summer' in Polish, reflecting its warm and friendly nature. It is well-balanced between classic and modern, giving it versatility for both body text and headings. Lato is warm, stable, and professional, with a slight twist of friendliness. It blends traditional letterform proportions with modern aesthetics, making it versatile for many uses, from body text to logos and headings. Lato italic also adds to the quirk of this font family.

Lato Font Details

  • Warm and Friendly: Lato’s semi-rounded letters give it a warm, humanistic touch while maintaining professionalism.
  • Balanced Design: Lato’s slightly round stroke caps balance seriousness and playfulness, making it suitable for serious or friendly branding.
  • Versatile Weights: With multiple weights and styles, Lato works well in different design contexts, from headers to body text.

How to Use Lato for Logo?

Lato features a warm, humanistic feel with semi-rounded letters that give off a friendly vibe. It’s great for brands that want to balance professionalism with approachability. This font works well in logos that aim to reflect openness and positivity, and it pairs nicely with playful or dynamic design elements.

How to Use Lato for Branding & Marketing?

Lato’s approachable yet professional tone is well-suited for branding that emphasizes friendliness and transparency. This makes it ideal for use in customer-facing materials, such as emails, websites, and packaging, where an inviting and relatable feel is important for the brand's identity.

Lato Font Pairing

  • Lato + Merriweather
  • Lato + Oswald
  • Lato + Poppins

Branding Example of the Week

Financial Services Branding for Lloyds Bank

Lloyds Bank is one of the leading retail and commercial banks in the United Kingdom. Lloyds Bank’s latest logo redesign modernizes the brand with a custom font while retaining the black horse symbol in the original branding. The horse symbol is also made sleeker and larger to reflect momentum and progression. The refreshed design focuses on updating the bank to feel more approachable.

Color Inspiration of the Week

This week enjoy this the lime shades of spring color palette.

entry.title: How to Use Raleway: An Elegant and Graceful E-commerce Font
entry.summary:
In This Issue…

  • What’s New in Branding: Branding of Tattoos
  • Font of the Week: Raleway
entry.content:
In This Issue…

  • What’s New in Branding: Branding of Tattoos
  • Font of the Week: Raleway

Font of the Week 

All About Raleway

Raleway is a stylish sans serif known for its thin strokes, inspired by neo-grotesque sans serifs. It exudes elegance and sophistication, perfect for larger headings, titles, and modern, creative design work. Its sleek lines and light weight make it ideal for a luxurious, minimalist aesthetic in large display sizes. My favorite part? Raleway has multiple weights and styles to support the design for a large, complex project. 

Raleway Font Details:

  • Elegant and Graceful: Raleway’s thin strokes give off a sleek and sophisticated feel. 
  • High-Contrast: It features high-contrast strokes, particularly in its bold weights, creating an upscale look.
  • Wide Range of Styles: Raleway offers multiple weights and styles for diverse design needs
  • Lining and Old Style Figures perfect for all type of lists and numerical figures

How to Use Raleway for Logo ?

Raleway is an elegant and sophisticated font, characterized by its thin, sleek strokes and modern appeal. It’s perfect for luxury brands, high-end products, or fashion-related logos. Use its thin versions for delicate, refined logos, or the bold versions for more impactful designs, pairing it with elegant visuals.

How to Use Raleway for Branding & Marketing?

Raleway’s elegant and sophisticated style makes it an ideal font for luxury branding. It is perfect for high-end product packaging, upscale magazine ads, and premium web designs. Its sleek lines create a sense of exclusivity and refinement that resonates with affluent audiences. There is also a nice bonus –Raleway comes with a dotted version that has dots as strokes. Using Raleway dots with Raleway quickly adds a quirky tone with beautiful visual texture. 

Raleway Font Pairing

  • Raleway + Roboto
  • Raleway + Lora
  • Raleway + Merriweather

Branding Example of the Week

Branding for Tattoo

Tattoox is a Barcelona-based startup that aims to democratize tattoo culture while building the largest tattoo community. The redesign emphasizes fluidity, featuring dynamic typography that mimics ink strokes and layered animations, emphasizing the artistry and vibrant energy of tattooing​. 

 

Color Inspiration of the Week

Spring Color Palette: Greens

This week, enjoy the calming greens of spring.

entry.title: How to Use Open Sans with Logo Examples
entry.summary:
In This Issue…

  • What’s New in Branding: Open Water
  • Font of the Week: Open Sans
entry.content:
In This Issue…

  • What’s New in Branding: Open Water
  • Font of the Week: Open Sans 

Font of the Week

All About Open Sans

Open Sans was created and inspired by the need for fonts with a humanist touch on digital screens. It’s a humanist sans-serif font, designed with open forms, giving off neutral and friendly vibes. It is ideal for web use because the font is designed for readability in digital environments. It contains open forms, like large counter spaces and relatively high x-hight, which optimizes legibility. Open Sans has multiple weights and styles making it a perfect choice for complex web projects.

 

 

Open Sans Font and Design Details

  • Highly Readable: Open Sans is designed with humanist letterforms, making it easy to read at any size. 
  • Neutral and Versatile: Its neutral style makes it versatile for a wide range of uses, from websites to print. 

How to Use Open Sans for Logo ?

Known for its readability and neutrality, Open Sans is great for logos that require a clean and approachable design. Its friendly yet professional appearance makes it ideal for businesses that want to convey trust and accessibility. Use this font with subtle design elements for a versatile and timeless logo.

How to Use Open Sans for Branding & Marketing?

Open Sans is perfect for brands that prioritize openness and clarity. Its approachable and friendly style ensures consistency in digital and print media. This font works well for marketing materials such as brochures, online ads, and social media posts, where conveying trust and ease of use is essential.

Open Sans Font Pairing

  • Open Sans + Raleway
  • Open Sans + Merriweather
  • Open Sans + Montserrat

Branding Example of the Week

Branding for Sustainability: Open Water 

Open Water is a sustainable beverage company offering purified enhanced water in aluminum cans to reduce plastic pollution. The new logo uses a fluid script style, evoking water's natural flow and reinforcing the brand's environmental mission. The redesign emphasizes approachability and lightness, aligning with Open Water’s goal of reducing plastic waste through recyclable aluminum packaging.

Color Inspiration of the Week

This week, enjoy this spring color palette featuring lavender and green shades.

entry.title: How to Use Merriweather: A Fantastic Text Font For Blogs
entry.summary:
In This Issue…
  • Font of the Week: Merriweather
  • What’s New in Branding: Zooplus
entry.content:
In This Issue…
  • Font of the Week: Merriweather
  • What’s New in Branding: Zooplus 
Font of the Week

Inspiration Behind Merriweather

Merriweather is a serif font created for on-screen reading. It is characterized by its slightly condensed letterforms and strong presence, offering both traditional style and modern legibility. With its condensed letterforms and traditional serif style, it is ideal for long-form content such as books or articles. The font’s sturdy, classic appearance offers a perfect balance between elegance and readability for on-screen text.

 

Merriweather Font Details

  • Classic Serif: Merriweather’s serif design brings a sense of tradition and reliability to any text. 
  • Optimized for Screen: Despite its classic look, it’s optimized for digital reading, making it perfect for web and e-book content. 
  • Readable at Small Sizes: Its slightly condensed letterforms and high x-height make it highly legible even at small sizes.

How to Use Merriweather for Logo

Merriweather is a serif font that evokes tradition, reliability, and sophistication. It’s perfect for logos of heritage brands, publications, or any company that wants to convey a classic and trustworthy image. Its readability makes it suitable for both bold and refined logo designs.

How to Use Merriweather for Branding & Marketing

Merriweather’s classic and reliable style is great for branding that emphasizes heritage and trust. It works well for financial services, law firms, and traditional industries. Use it in print ads, corporate materials, and editorial content where a timeless and credible look is essential.

Merriweather Font Pairings:

  • Merriweather + Raleway
  • Merriweather + Open Sans
  • Merriweather + Montserrat
Brand Identity Example of the Week

Zooplus

Zooplus is a leading online retailer specializing in pet supplies across Europe.Zooplus' old design featured a more conventional pet-focused identity, with straightforward branding elements. The new design introduces playful touches, such as a refreshed logo with distinctive “eyes,” while keeping the familiar green color palette This updated look emphasizes fun and personalization.  

Color Inspiration of the Week

This week, enjoy beautiful spring color palette inspired by Monet's garden.
